DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Regression Or Stability Without Therapeutic Procedure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was disease stability or regression without further therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Regression Or Stability Without Therapeutic Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Return to a former state; a subsidence of the symptoms of a disease process; in cancer, a decrease in the size of a tumor or in the extent of cancer in the body._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The quality of being free from change or variation or not taking part readily in chemical change._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Regression Or Stability Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor or in the extent of cancer in the body.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The quality of being free from change or variation or not taking part readily in chemical change.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Return to a former state; a subsidence of the symptoms of a disease process; in cancer, a decrease in the size of a tumor or in the extent of cancer in the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The quality of being free from change or variation or not taking part readily in chemical change.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
